content.description: Stand start with any number of possible combinations at the rock's blunt, west arete. From there, make a few awkward pulls on the thin arete (crux), gain a small but decent sidepull, gain the top lip, and finish it off.
content.protection: A pad should do it, the landing is pretty nice.
content.location: It ascends the western most arete on Lacuna Rock's south face.

content.description: Stand start at the rock's southeast arete. From there, lean back on the positive arete, gain a high, thin foot edge (crux), then work the hands up the remaining arete, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad should work fine, the landing is very good.
content.location: It ascends the east arete of Lacuna's south face.

content.description:
Domestic Bliss climbs a perfect slab on incut edges. It shares many of the same holds as

Rubbing Wigglies

and

Bug Lift

, this just eliminates the left and right aretes.

Stand start with an incut left hand edge, three-finger right hand incut bump/pinch, and a high left foot. From there, crank up to gain a thin right foot edge, bump the left up to an inverted pinch with a decent thumb-catch (crux?), mantle the starting right hand, bump the right foot up, gain the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad should work just fine, the landing is very good.
content.location: It ascends the center Lacuna's south face. Both the the east and west aretes are off.
